This brilliant cautionary tale can also be read as a clever indictment of the stupidity and corruption of the legal system and government bureaucracy.

English.Name: The Murders in the Rue Morgue
English.Author: Edgar Allan Poe
English.Description: This is a pioneering detective story in which C. Auguste Dupin, a brilliant amateur sleuth, solves a seemingly inexplicable murder case involving gruesome deaths in Paris. It is considered one of the earliest examples of the detective fiction genre.

English.Name: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
English.Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
English.Description: This novella tells the story of a London lawyer, Gabriel John Utterson, who investigates the mysterious connection between Dr. Henry Jekyll, a respected scientist, and the sinister Edward Hyde. It explores themes of duality, morality, and the darker aspects of human nature.

English.Name: A Study in Scarlet
English.Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
English.Description: This novel introduces the iconic detective Sherlock Holmes and his companion Dr. John Watson. Together, they investigate a complex murder case involving revenge, conspiracy, and a secret society in Victorian London.

English.Name: Pride and Prejudice
English.Author: Jane Austen
English.Description: Set in early 19th-century England, this novel follows the romantic exploits of the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and the enigmatic Mr. Darcy. It explores themes of class, marriage, and the complexities of human relationships in Regency-era society.

English.Name: Jane Eyre
English.Author: Charlotte Brontë
English.Description: This classic novel follows the life of the titular character, Jane Eyre, an orphan who becomes a governess at Thornfield Hall and falls in love with the brooding Mr. Rochester. It is a tale of love, independence, and personal growth set against the backdrop of Victorian England.

English.Name: Great Expectations
English.Author: Charles Dickens
English.Description: This classic novel follows the life of Pip, an orphan who rises from humble beginnings to pursue his "great expectations" of wealth and social status. Along the way, he encounters memorable characters, navigates complex relationships, and learns valuable lessons about identity and redemption.

English.Name: Wuthering Heights
English.Author: Emily Brontë
English.Description: Emily Brontë's only novel is a dark and passionate tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors. It follows the doomed love affair between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff, and the destructive forces it unleashes.

English.Name: Frankenstein
English.Author: Mary Shelley
English.Description: Often considered the first science fiction novel, "Frankenstein" tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a monstrous creature. The novel explores themes of ambition, responsibility, and the consequences of unchecked ambition.

English.Name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
English.Author: Oscar Wilde
English.Description: Oscar Wilde's only novel follows the handsome and wealthy Dorian Gray, who sells his soul to maintain his youthful appearance while his portrait ages. The novel explores themes of vanity, morality, and the pursuit of beauty.

English.Name: Boy, Tales of Childhood
English.Author: Roald Dahl
English.Description: This autobiographical work by Roald Dahl recounts his childhood experiences, including tales of mischief, adventure, and the formative events that shaped his life and inspired his imaginative storytelling.

English.Name: To Kill a Mockingbird
English.Author: Harper Lee
English.Description: Set in the racially charged atmosphere of the American South during the 1930s, this novel follows young Scout Finch as she comes of age and learns about morality, empathy, and the importance of standing up for what is right, as her father, Atticus Finch, defends a black man falsely accused of rape.

English.Name: Hamlet
English.Author: William Shakespeare
English.Description: Perhaps the most famous play ever written, Hamlet is a complex and enduring story of revenge, betrayal, and madness. Prince Hamlet of Denmark grapples with the ghost of his murdered father, who demands revenge on his killer, Hamlet's uncle Claudius, who has now seized the throne and married Hamlet's mother.

English.Name: King Lear
English.Author: William Shakespeare
English.Description: Another of Shakespeare's greatest tragedies, King Lear tells the story of an aging king who foolishly divides his kingdom among his two daughters, Goneril and Regan, who flatter him, and disinherits his third daughter, Cordelia, who speaks the truth. Lear soon discovers the true nature of his elder daughters and descends into madness.

English.Name: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
English.Author: Robert Louis Stevenson
English.Description: This novella tells the story of a London lawyer, Gabriel John Utterson, who investigates the mysterious connection between Dr. Henry Jekyll, a respected scientist, and the sinister Edward Hyde. It explores themes of duality, morality, and the darker aspects of human nature.

English.Name: The Importance of Being Earnest
English.Author: Oscar Wilde
English.Description: A hilarious comedy of manners by Oscar Wilde, this play follows two gentlemen who lead double lives in order to escape the social pressures of Victorian England. Filled with witty dialogue and clever wordplay, the play is a delightful satire of upper-class society.

English.Name: A Doll's House
English.Author: Henrik Ibsen
English.Description: A groundbreaking drama by Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen, A Doll's House explores the oppression of women in 19th-century society. The play tells the story of Nora Helmer, a seemingly happy housewife who eventually rebels against her controlling husband.

English.Name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
English.Author: Oscar Wilde
English.Description: This Gothic novel by Oscar Wilde tells the story of Dorian Gray, a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth. As Dorian indulges in a life of pleasure and sin, his portrait bears the marks of his corruption, while he remains forever young and beautiful.

English.Name: The Count of Monte Cristo
English.Author: Alexandre Dumas
English.Description: An adventure novel by French writer Alexandre Dumas, this classic tale follows Edmond Dantes, a man who is wrongly imprisoned for a crime he did not commit. After escaping from prison, Dantes transforms himself into the wealthy and mysterious Count of Monte Cristo and sets out to exact revenge on those who betrayed him.

English.Name: The Glass Menagerie
English.Author: Tennessee Williams
English.Description: This autobiographical play by Tennessee Williams tells the story of a struggling family living in St. Louis during the Great Depression. The Wingfield family consists of Amanda, a faded Southern belle clinging to memories of her youth, her son Tom, a warehouse worker who escapes his reality through movies and writing, and her daughter Laura, a shy and fragile young woman with a collection of glass animals. Amanda desperately desires a "gentleman caller" for Laura, but her illusions clash with the harsh realities of their situation. The play explores themes of memory, illusion, escape, and the yearning for connection.

English.Name: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
English.Author: Lewis Carroll
English.Description: A young girl named Alice chases a white rabbit down a hole and finds herself in the nonsensical world of Wonderland, filled with tea parties, talking animals, and a mad queen.

English.Name: The Lord of the Rings trilogy
English.Author: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien
English.Description: This epic fantasy series follows the quest to destroy the One Ring, which holds immense power and threatens to plunge Middle-earth into darkness. The story encompasses themes of heroism, friendship, sacrifice, and the struggle between good and evil.

English.Name: Frankenstein
English.Author: Mary Shelley
English.Description: This classic Gothic novel tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox experiment. The novel explores themes of ambition, responsibility, and the consequences of unchecked scientific pursuit.

English.Name: Great Expectations
English.Author: Charles Dickens
English.Description: This coming-of-age novel follows the journey of Pip, an orphan who rises from humble beginnings to pursue his "great expectations" of wealth and social status. It is a richly detailed narrative that explores themes of ambition, identity, and the impact of society on individuals.

English.Author: George Orwell
English.Description: Set in a dystopian future where totalitarianism reigns, "1984" follows Winston Smith, a low-ranking member of the ruling Party, as he rebels against the oppressive regime led by Big Brother. The novel explores themes of surveillance, censorship, propaganda, and the nature of truth.

English.Name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: No Brainer
English.Author: Jeff Kinney
English.Description: In this installment of the "Diary of a Wimpy Kid" series by Jeff Kinney, middle schooler Greg Heffley faces new challenges, mishaps, and humorous adventures as he navigates the ups and downs of adolescence.

English.Name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
English.Author: Jeff Kinney
English.Description: This popular children's book series follows the humorous misadventures of Greg Heffley, a middle schooler navigating the challenges of adolescence, friendships, and family life. Presented in diary format with accompanying illustrations, the books offer a lighthearted and relatable look at the ups and downs of growing up.

English.Name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days
English.Author: Jeff Kinney
English.Description: In this installment of the "Diary of a Wimpy Kid" series, Greg Heffley faces the trials and tribulations of summer vacation, including failed attempts at outdoor activities, family vacations, and encounters with his eccentric relatives. The book continues the humorous and engaging style of the series.

English.Name: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Ugly Truth
English.Author: Jeff Kinney
English.Description: As Greg Heffley navigates the challenges of middle school and adolescence, he grapples with issues of friendship, identity, and self-discovery. In "The Ugly Truth," Greg confronts the awkwardness of puberty, the complexities of relationships, and the pressures of growing up in a humorous and relatable manner.

English.Name: Frankenstein
English.Author: Mary Shelley
English.Description: Often considered the first science fiction novel, "Frankenstein" tells the story of Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a monstrous creature. The novel explores themes of ambition, responsibility, and the consequences of unchecked ambition.

English.Name: The Haunting of Hill House
English.Author: Shirley Jackson
English.Description: This classic horror novel follows four individuals who gather at the mysterious Hill House to investigate its reputed supernatural phenomena. As they delve deeper into the house's dark history, they are consumed by fear and terror.

English.Name: Coraline
English.Author: Neil Gaiman
English.Description: Coraline, bored with her life, discovers a door to a parallel world that seems perfect at first. But this world hides a sinister secret, and Coraline must use her courage and ingenuity to escape.

English.Name: The Shining
English.Author: Stephen King
English.Description: Jack Torrance, an aspiring writer and recovering alcoholic, accepts a job as the winter caretaker of the remote Overlook Hotel, where he hopes to work on his novel. However, as winter sets in, the hotel's sinister influence begins to unravel his sanity, leading to horrifying consequences for him and his family.

English.Name: The Lottery
English.Author: Shirley Jackson
English.Description: In this chilling short story, the residents of a small town gather annually for a ritualistic lottery, the true nature of which becomes increasingly disturbing as the story unfolds. It is a powerful commentary on conformity, tradition, and the darker aspects of human nature.

English.Name: The Exorcist
English.Author: William Peter Blatty
English.Description: This horror novel follows the demonic possession of a young girl named Regan and the efforts of two priests to save her soul through an exorcism. The novel explores themes of faith, evil, and the battle between good and evil.

English.Name: And Then There Were None
English.Author: Agatha Christie
English.Description: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island mansion, only to find themselves cut off from the outside world and picked off one by one according to a sinister nursery rhyme.

English.Name: Sharp Objects
English.Author: Gillian Flynn
English.Description: Sharp Objects is a psychological thriller novel by American author Gillian Flynn. It follows Camille Preaker, a troubled journalist who returns to her hometown to cover the murders of two young girls. As Camille delves deeper into the investigation, she begins to uncover dark secrets about her own family and the town she left behind.

English.Name: Storyteller
English.Author: Edgar Allan Poe
English.Description: In this novel, Sage Singer, a reclusive baker, forms an unlikely friendship with an elderly man named Josef Weber, who confesses to being a former Nazi SS guard. As Sage grapples with the moral implications of Josef's past, she confronts her own demons and learns the power of forgiveness.

English.Name: Sharp Objects
English.Author: Gillian Flynn
English.Description: Sharp Objects is a psychological thriller novel by American author Gillian Flynn. It follows Camille Preaker, a troubled journalist who returns to her hometown to cover the murders of two young girls. As Camille delves deeper into the investigation, she begins to uncover dark secrets about her own family and the town she left behind.

English.Name: The Big Four
English.Author: Agatha Christie
English.Description: In this Hercule Poirot mystery, the famous detective investigates a series of seemingly unrelated murders, all of which are connected to an international criminal organization known as "The Big Four." Poirot must unravel the complex web of clues to stop their nefarious plot.

English.Name: The Hound of the Baskervilles
English.Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
English.Description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson investigate the mysterious death of Sir Charles Baskerville, whose demise is rumored to be linked to a family curse involving a supernatural hound. The novel is one of Conan Doyle's most famous Sherlock Holmes mysteries.

English.Name: The Mystery of the Edwin Drood
English.Author: Charles Dickens
English.Description: This unfinished novel by Charles Dickens follows the mysterious disappearance of Edwin Drood, a young man engaged to Rosa Bud. Set in a small English town, the novel explores themes of love, jealousy, and obsession while leaving readers to ponder the unresolved mystery of Drood's fate.

English.Name: Rebecca
English.Author: Daphne du Maurier
English.Description: In this Gothic novel, a young woman marries the wealthy widower Maxim de Winter and moves to his estate, Manderley. There, she becomes haunted by the memory of Maxim's deceased first wife, Rebecca, whose presence looms large over the house and its inhabitants.

English.Name: The Woman in White
English.Author: Wilkie Collins
English.Description: This Victorian sensation novel follows the mysterious circumstances surrounding the enigmatic woman in white and her connection to the wealthy heiress Laura Fairlie. The novel is renowned for its intricate plot, suspenseful atmosphere, and memorable characters.

English.Name: And Then There Were None
English.Author: Agatha Christie
English.Description: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island mansion, only to find themselves cut off from the outside world and picked off one by one according to a sinister nursery rhyme.

English.Name: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
English.Author: Agatha Christie
English.Description: Poirot investigates the murder of a wealthy man, only to find that the killer is someone much closer to home than anyone expects.

English.Name: The Moonstone
English.Author: Wilkie Collins
English.Description: Often considered one of the first detective novels in English literature, "The Moonstone" revolves around the theft of a valuable diamond, the Moonstone, and the subsequent investigation to uncover the truth behind its disappearance.

English.Name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
English.Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
English.Description: This collection of short stories features the legendary detective Sherlock Holmes and his faithful companion Dr. John Watson as they solve a series of intriguing mysteries, showcasing Holmes's deductive prowess and keen observational skills.

English.Name: The Love Hypothesis
English.Author: Ali Hazelwood
English.Description: In this contemporary romance novel, Ph.D. candidate Olive Smith finds herself in a fake relationship with her grumpy professor, Adam Carlsen, to prove a scientific hypothesis about love. As their pretend relationship deepens, Olive discovers unexpected truths about herself and her feelings for Adam.

English.Name: Jane Eyre
English.Author: Charlotte Brontë
English.Description: Jane Eyre, an orphaned girl, endures a harsh upbringing before finding employment as a gover

English.Name: Pride and Prejudice
English.Author: Jane Austen
English.Description: Elizabeth Bennet is a strong-willed young woman who resists the advances of the arrogant Mr. Darcy. However, as they get to know each other, their feelings begin to change.

English.Name: It Ends With Us
English.Author: Colleen Hoover
English.Description: This contemporary romance novel follows Lily Bloom, a young woman who grapples with her complicated past and the return of her first love, Ryle Kincaid. As their relationship unfolds, Lily must confront difficult truths and make choices that will shape her future.

English.Name: It Starts With Us
English.Author: Colleen Hoover
English.Description: In this steamy romance novel, engineer Dara Kazav and wildlife photographer Adam Pengelly find themselves drawn to each other during a conservation project in the Australian Outback. As they navigate their budding romance, they must confront their pasts and overcome obstacles to find happiness together.

English.Name: Little Women
English.Author: Louisa May Alcott
English.Description: Set against the backdrop of the Civil War, "Little Women" follows the lives of the March sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy—as they come of age and navigate the challenges of love, friendship, and family. The novel is celebrated for its enduring themes of sisterhood, resilience, and the pursuit of dreams.

English.Name: Red, White & Royal Blue
English.Author: Casey McQuiston
English.Description: In this contemporary romance novel, the First Son of the United States, Alex Claremont-Diaz, and Prince Henry of Wales embark on a secret romance that threatens to upend their lives and the political landscape. The novel explores themes of love, identity, and the power of authenticity.

English.Name: Pride and Prejudice
English.Author: Jane Austen
English.Description: Set in early 19th-century England, this beloved novel follows the romantic exploits of Elizabeth Bennet and the enigmatic Mr. Darcy. Against the backdrop of Regency-era society, the novel explores themes of love, marriage, and class as the characters navigate the complexities of social expectations and personal relationships.

English.Name: Wuthering Heights
English.Author: Emily Brontë
English.Description: Emily Brontë's only novel is a dark and passionate tale of love and revenge on the Yorkshire moors. It follows the doomed love affair between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff, and the destructive forces it unleashes.

English.Name: The Three Musketeers
English.Author: Alexandre Dumas
English.Description: An adventure follows a young man named d'Artagnan who dreams of joining the king's Musketeers. He finds himself aligned with three legendary Musketeers - Athos, Porthos, and Aramis - and together they fight for justice, honor, and the beautiful Constance.

English.Name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
English.Author: Mark Twain
English.Description: Huck Finn, a young boy living on the Mississippi River, escapes his abusive father and runs away on a raft with Jim, a runaway slave. Their journey down the river exposes Huck to the brutality of racism and helps him develop his own sense of morality.

English.Name: The Metamorphosis
English.Author: Franz Kafka
English.Description: Gregor Samsa, a traveling salesman, wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect. He struggles to adapt to his new form and care for his family, while they grapple with fear, disgust, and isolation.

English.Name: The Call of the Wild
English.Author: Jack London
English.Description: Buck, a pampered sled dog, is stolen and taken to the harsh Alaskan wilderness. He reverts to his primal instincts and becomes a powerful leader of a wolf pack.

English.Name: Fahrenheit 451
English.Author: Ray Bradbury
English.Description: In a future where books are outlawed, fireman Guy Montag starts to question the society he lives in. When he meets a group of rebels who preserve books, he must choose between his job and his newfound beliefs.

English.Name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
English.Author: Douglas Adams
English.Description: Arthur Dent escapes Earth's destruction with his friend Ford Prefect, who reveals himself to be an alien researcher for the titular Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy. Together, they travel through space and time, encountering strange characters and absurd situations.

English.Name: A Handmaid's Tale
English.Author: Margaret Atwood
English.Description: Offred is a Handmaid in Gilead, a totalitarian regime that forces women into sexual servitude as a response to declining birth rates. The story explores themes of oppression, female subjugation, and the importance of freedom.

English.Name: The Princess Bride
English.Author: William Goldman
English.Description: Westley must rescue his love Princess Buttercup from the evil Prince Humperdinck. The story is a hilarious and heartwarming tale of love, adventure, and piracy as Goldman retells a classic fairy tale for adults.

English.Name: Coraline
English.Author: Neil Gaiman
English.Description: Coraline, bored with her life, discovers a door to a parallel world that seems perfect at first. But this world hides a sinister secret, and Coraline must use her courage and ingenuity to escape.

English.Name: The Stranger
English.Author: Harlan Coben
English.Description: Harlan Coben is a master of the twisty thriller, and The Stranger is no exception. When Adam Price discovers a secret about his wife that leaves him questioning everything he thought he knew, he's determined to get to the bottom of it. But the deeper he digs, the more danger he finds himself in.

English.Name: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
English.Author: Stieg Larsson
English.Description: Lisbeth Salander, a brilliant young hacker with a troubled past, is hired by a disgraced journalist to investigate the disappearance of a young woman from a wealthy family years ago. Their investigation leads them down a dark path filled with corruption and violence.

English.Name: The Silence of the Lambs
English.Author: Thomas Harris
English.Description: FBI trainee Clarice Starling is sent to interview Dr. Hannibal Lecter, a brilliant psychiatrist who also happens to be a cannibalistic serial killer. She hopes to gain his insights into another killer who is on the loose.

English.Name: The Martian
English.Author: Andy Weir
English.Description: An astronaut is stranded on Mars and presumed dead, but he's not giving up. He must use his ingenuity and resourcefulness to survive until a rescue mission can be mounted.

English.Name: The Woman in White
English.Author: Wilkie Collins
English.Description: A young man encounters a mysterious woman in white who claims to have escaped from an asylum. He becomes determined to help her, but he soon finds himself entangled in a web of lies and deceit.

English.Name: Rebecca
English.Author: Daphne du Maurier
English.Description: In this Gothic novel, a young woman marries the wealthy widower Maxim de Winter and moves to his estate, Manderley. There, she becomes haunted by the memory of Maxim's deceased first wife, Rebecca, whose presence looms large over the house and its inhabitants.

English.Name: And Then There Were None
English.Author: Agatha Christie
English.Description: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island mansion, only to find themselves cut off from the outside world and picked off one by one according to a sinister nursery rhyme.

English.Name: The Count of Monte Cristo
English.Author: Alexandre Dumas
English.Description: An adventure novel by French writer Alexandre Dumas, this classic tale follows Edmond Dantes, a man who is wrongly imprisoned for a crime he did not commit. After escaping from prison, Dantes transforms himself into the wealthy and mysterious Count of Monte Cristo and sets out to exact revenge on those who betrayed him.

English.Name: The Kindred
English.Author: Octavia Butler
English.Description: Dana, a young African American woman, finds herself inexplicably transported back in time to a slave plantation in the antebellum South.

English.Name: In Cold Blood
English.Author: Truman Capote
English.Description: In Cold Blood is a true-crime account of the murders of a Kansas farm family. Capote spent years interviewing the killers and those who knew them, resulting in a chilling

English.Name: Gone Girl
English.Author: Gillian Flynn
English.Description: Nick Dunne returns home to find his wife, Amy, missing. The police suspect him, but Nick claims he has nothing to do with her disappearance. As the media frenzy intensifies, Nick must clear his name and find Amy.

Urdu.Name: Aish Dost
Urdu.Author: Prof Khadim Muhiuddin
Urdu.Description: A fictional tale exploring the intricacies of relationships and human emotions.

Urdu.Name: Badi Didi
Urdu.Author: Sharat Chandra
Urdu.Description: A captivating narrative delving into family dynamics and societal norms.

Urdu.Name: Nasheman
Urdu.Author: Abida Hijab Lakhnawi
Urdu.Description: A work of fiction that paints a vivid picture of love, loss, and resilience.

Urdu.Name: Aag Ka Darya
Urdu.Author: Qurratulain Hyder
Urdu.Description: A monumental saga spanning generations, reflecting on the passage of time and the evolution of society.

Urdu.Name: Yazeed
Urdu.Author: Saadat Hassan Manto
Urdu.Description: A collection of stories that push the boundaries of conventional storytelling, exploring the depths of human nature.

Urdu.Name: Kulliyat-e-Mir
Urdu.Author: Mir Taqi Mir
Urdu.Description: A treasury of poetic brilliance, showcasing the timeless verses of one of Urdu's greatest poets.

Urdu.Name: Diwan-e-Ghalib
Urdu.Author: Mirza Asadullah Khan Ghalib
Urdu.Description: A compilation of poetic masterpieces, expressing the profound musings of a poetic genius.

Urdu.Name: Iqbal Imam-e-Adab
Urdu.Author: Rais Ahmed Jafri
Urdu.Description: A poetic tribute to the philosophical legacy of Allama Iqbal, resonating with themes of self-discovery and enlightenment.

Urdu.Name: Kulliyat-e-Faiz
Urdu.Author: Faiz Ahmad Faiz
Urdu.Description: A profound collection of poetry, encapsulating the revolutionary spirit and lyrical genius of Faiz Ahmad Faiz.

Urdu.Name: Dastan-e-Amir Hamza
Urdu.Author: Folklore
Urdu.Description: An adventurous saga from folklore, recounting the heroic exploits of Amir Hamza in a fantastical world.
